results.title: What makes me, me
results.creator_credit: Robbie Palm, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: One of Robbie Palm’s favourite things is fishing at the creek of his nan’s property. Even though he goes to boarding school in Brisbane, he returns during school holidays to fish. He has been taught by his family the techniques and it is this, and when he plays the Didgeridoo that Robbie feels most connected to his culture. When he plays, he feels proud and watched by his family, both current and past.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robbie Palm, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Spotlights: Ana Kokkinos
results.brief_description: An Australian film and TV director and screenwriter of Greek descent born in Melbourne. Kokkinos has directed three feature-length films and two short films including Head On (1998), The Book of Revelation (2006) and Blessed (2009).

constellations_primary.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_primary.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.description: Ana Kokkinos is an Australian filmmaker and screenwriter of Greek descent born in Melbourne. Kokkinos has directed features and two shorts including Head On (1998), The Book of Revelation (2006) and Blessed (2009). Here she discusses diversity, particularly in relation to class and queerness.
description_for_label: Ana Kokkinos is an Australian filmmaker and screenwriter of Greek descent born in Melbourne. Kokkinos has directed features and two shorts including Head On (1998), The Book of Revelation (2006) and Blessed (2009). Here she discusses diversity, particularly in relation to class and queerness.

results.title: From the earth to the moon
results.creator_credit: Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description: Produced with the cooperation of NASA, these are the stories of the men, women and children who lived and breathed the great American dream as it became reality through the voyages of the Apollo astronauts in their mission to place a man on the moon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base

results.title: Springboard to the sun
results.creator_credit: Jean Dansereau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Filmed at the 4th Pan-American Games at Sao Paulo, Brazil as gymnastic teams from North, South and Central America demonstrate a perfection of grace, form and strength.

results.title: Spring ball [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: At the Annual Senior Citizens Spring Ball another woman is named Spring Belle. Over the course of the evening, memories of friends lost as well as the lives that they’ve led will be shared. A powerful short film shot in Wagga about ageing with dignity and the era of Spring Dances and all they encompass. (Awards: Voted most popular Australian Short Film, Sydney Film Festival, 1993)

results.title: Mare tranquilitatis
results.creator_credit: Frank Marshall, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
It would be the culmination of John F. Kennedy’s dream. On July 20th 1969, after years of development and training, Apollo 11 - with its team of Neil Armstrong, Edward “Buzz” Aldrin Jr., and Michael Collins - is about to land a man on the moon. The world is watching, and America holds its breath as Neil Armstrong takes “one small step for man - one giant leap for mankind.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Marshall, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base

results.title: Three sisters and three ukuleles
results.creator_credit: T'Kido Titasey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: T’Kido Titasey dedicates this story to his grandmother. Born a Torres Strait Islander, she never received a formal education but was taught about survival. After World War II, she set up a ukulele band with her two sisters. It became popular and The Mill Sisters travelled around the world and landed a recording deal. Gran’s resourcefulness and eagerness to try new things took her and her sisters on an amazing adventure and has been an immense inspiration to T’Kido.

results.title: Spot goes to the farm
results.brief_description: Six fabulous stories featuring Spot, the world’s favourite puppy. 1. “Spot goes to the farm” - Spot and his dad, Sam, visit a farm to find some baby animals. 2. “Spot stays overnight” - Spot stays overnight with his friend, Steve the Monkey, and almost forgets to take his teddy bear. 3. “Spot makes a cake” - Spot helps his mum Sally to make a cake for a fair. 4. “Spot goes to the park” - At the park, a friendly frog helps Spot find his ball. 5. “Spot finds a key” - Where does the key fit? Spot sets out on a search to discover the answer. 6. “Spot in the garden” - Spot has lots of fun helping his dad with the watering and mum with the vegie garden. Based on the book by Eric Hill.

results.title: Spider
results.creator_credit: Graham Yost, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
Before America could land on the moon, it had to devise the lunar module named “LEM” or “Spider”. From an idea on a sketch pad to design and construction; through nine years of rigorous tests, successes and failures. 1969 will witness the first ever docking of two manned vessels in space on Apollo 9, and the first flight of a lunar module in the moon’s orbit on Apollo 10. With all systems go, that same year would see the lift-off of Apollo 11.

results.creator_credit: Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
In a year marked by anti-Vietnam war prtesets, when Russia seemed ready to send a man to the moon, Frank Borman, Jim Lovell and William Anders prepare for the launch of Apollo 8, the first ever manned voyage to the moon. Their aim is to reach the moon and remain in lunar orbit, the greatest risk is that they have a single engine that must break their orbit if it is to bring them home safely.
